              </h2>
              <p class="sqsrte-large" style="text-align:center;white-space:pre-wrap;">
               At the Master’s Programme in Human Rights Policy and Practice you get the opportunity to study human rights from a multidisciplinary perspective, in four different countries. This full-time programme is organized by a consortium of four partner universities and taught in English. After graduation, you will be prepared to work professionally with human rights in a changing global context.

              </h2>
              <p class="sqsrte-large" style="text-align:center;white-space:pre-wrap;">
               At the Master’s Programme in Human Rights Policy and Practice you get the opportunity to study human rights from a multidisciplinary perspective, in four different countries. This full-time programme is organized by a consortium of four partner universities and taught in English. After graduation, you will be prepared to work professionally with human rights in a changing global context.

              <h2 style="text-align:center;white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Are you passionate about human rights?
              </h2>
              <p class="sqsrte-large" style="text-align:center;white-space:pre-wrap;">
               At the Master’s Programme in Human Rights Policy and Practice you get the opportunity to study human rights from a multidisciplinary perspective, in four different countries. This full-time programme is organized by a consortium of four partner universities and taught in English. After graduation, you will be prepared to work professionally with human rights in a changing global context.

      <div class="section-border">
       <div class="section-background">
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="content-wrapper" style="
      
        
      
    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5f8ef665ea2c9117d237d2ee">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-f3571ad34932ffff0c47">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="about">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-5d9baa56d8670245c077">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               About the programme
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Human rights is an interdisciplinary field and require an understanding of legal and political processes, globalization, social structures and civil society, methodologies needed to ensure reliable data, and the cultural and ethnic boundaries that challenge human rights implementation.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <br/>
               One programme - four universities
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The Erasmus Mundus master’s programme in Human Rights Policy and Practice is organized by a consortium of four partner universities:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The University of Gothenburg, Sweden (lead partner);
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The University of Deusto, Bilbao/San Sebastian, Spain;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Roehampton University, London, UK;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The Arctic University of Norway (UIT), Tromsø, Norway.
                 <br/>
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The first semester of study begins in August and takes place at the University of Gothenburg, the second semester at the University of Deusto, and a third semester at the University of Roehampton. Mobility to Norway will be included for those students supervised in their master thesis by UIT. Teaching modules will be complemented with a Professional Seminar Series, field visits, and an internship during the third semester with a human rights organization in London. During the fourth semester, you are required to write a dissertation, supervised by academic staff from one of the four partner universities.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <br/>
               Immersive learning and joint teaching
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The programme offers a uniquely comprehensive and immersive approach to teaching and learning, allowing you to build your skills, knowledge, and practical experience and prepare yourself to be a confident professional in the field of human rights.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Through lectures, group teaching, seminars, and field visits, you will learn about these main subjects:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 human rights theory
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 human rights in the context of politics and the market economy
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 research methods and methodologies
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 human rights defenders
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 social movements and nongovernmental organizations
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Preparing you for professional work in human rights
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our programme has an enhanced focus on employability and professionalization. Particular attention is paid to provide you with a range of core skills for employment, such as report writing, project management, campaign creation, and public speaking, embedded throughout the various modules.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Furthermore, the Professional Seminar Series will give you additional opportunities to practise what you learn. Associate Partners from academia and the public, corporate, and third sectors are involved in the design and delivery of the seminars, and in organizing study visits throughout the duration of the programme. Lastly, during the third semester, there is an internship possibility with a human rights organization in London. These various forms of integrated collaboration will prepare you for the challenges of building and enhancing your career after graduation in the field of human rights.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Do you have any questions? Please contact our program administrators:
               <a href="mailto:emhrppugot@gu.se">
                emhrppugot@gu.se
               </a>
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-d79e82f1d1efd939e7a7">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="structure-content">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-5907b780b01d8a8deee6">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Structure and content
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The first semester in Sweden lays the foundation for the programme by introducing human rights as an interdisciplinary field and begins to examine where responsibility for human rights should lie.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The second semester in Spain prepares you to produce and access quality human rights knowledge and evidence, and examines relativistic approaches to human rights in light of cultural and ethnic diversity.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The third semester in the UK gives you the opportunity to practise what you have learned through an internship at a human rights organization in London, the Professional Seminar Series, and modules about theorizing human rights and social change.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The fourth semester consists of writing your master’s thesis in Human Rights Policy and Practice, based at one of the four partner universities.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-6a50cf842e5f0da51a9c">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="who-should-apply">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-e7763353eb849bb9767d">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Who should apply?
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Apply to the programme if you are looking to gain critical knowledge of human rights and want to pursue international studies. The programme offers a unique interdisciplinary take on human rights, and broaden your skillset with both in-depth academic studies and practical experience.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-8da4703c56ad33e2fa77">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="after-graduation">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-a1c39faa245f21fbb1cf">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               After graduation
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Graduates receive the joint Degree of Master of Arts in Human Rights Policy and Practice, issued by the University of Gothenburg.
               <br/>
               After graduation, you will be prepared to:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 work professionally and effectively with the protection, promotion, and implementation of human rights in a changing global context;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 use analytical skills and expertise in human rights perspectives, contexts, organizations, policy-making, and practice;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 evaluate and apply these skills to different cases and environments;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 and develop human rights-based policies, programmes, and projects with professionalism.
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our alumni work for nongovernmental organizations such as Amnesty International, Doctors Without Borders, and Save the Children, in various UN agencies, and as lawyers, researchers, and teachers.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </article>

      <div class="section-border">
       <div class="section-background">
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="content-wrapper" style="
      
        
      
    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5f8ef665ea2c9117d237d2ee">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-f3571ad34932ffff0c47">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="about">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-5d9baa56d8670245c077">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               About the programme
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Human rights is an interdisciplinary field and require an understanding of legal and political processes, globalization, social structures and civil society, methodologies needed to ensure reliable data, and the cultural and ethnic boundaries that challenge human rights implementation.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <br/>
               One programme - four universities
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The Erasmus Mundus master’s programme in Human Rights Policy and Practice is organized by a consortium of four partner universities:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The University of Gothenburg, Sweden (lead partner);
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The University of Deusto, Bilbao/San Sebastian, Spain;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Roehampton University, London, UK;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The Arctic University of Norway (UIT), Tromsø, Norway.
                 <br/>
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The first semester of study begins in August and takes place at the University of Gothenburg, the second semester at the University of Deusto, and a third semester at the University of Roehampton. Mobility to Norway will be included for those students supervised in their master thesis by UIT. Teaching modules will be complemented with a Professional Seminar Series, field visits, and an internship during the third semester with a human rights organization in London. During the fourth semester, you are required to write a dissertation, supervised by academic staff from one of the four partner universities.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <br/>
               Immersive learning and joint teaching
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The programme offers a uniquely comprehensive and immersive approach to teaching and learning, allowing you to build your skills, knowledge, and practical experience and prepare yourself to be a confident professional in the field of human rights.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Through lectures, group teaching, seminars, and field visits, you will learn about these main subjects:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 human rights theory
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 human rights in the context of politics and the market economy
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 research methods and methodologies
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 human rights defenders
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 social movements and nongovernmental organizations
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Preparing you for professional work in human rights
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our programme has an enhanced focus on employability and professionalization. Particular attention is paid to provide you with a range of core skills for employment, such as report writing, project management, campaign creation, and public speaking, embedded throughout the various modules.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Furthermore, the Professional Seminar Series will give you additional opportunities to practise what you learn. Associate Partners from academia and the public, corporate, and third sectors are involved in the design and delivery of the seminars, and in organizing study visits throughout the duration of the programme. Lastly, during the third semester, there is an internship possibility with a human rights organization in London. These various forms of integrated collaboration will prepare you for the challenges of building and enhancing your career after graduation in the field of human rights.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Do you have any questions? Please contact our program administrators:
               <a href="mailto:emhrppugot@gu.se">
                emhrppugot@gu.se
               </a>
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-d79e82f1d1efd939e7a7">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="structure-content">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-5907b780b01d8a8deee6">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Structure and content
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The first semester in Sweden lays the foundation for the programme by introducing human rights as an interdisciplinary field and begins to examine where responsibility for human rights should lie.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The second semester in Spain prepares you to produce and access quality human rights knowledge and evidence, and examines relativistic approaches to human rights in light of cultural and ethnic diversity.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The third semester in the UK gives you the opportunity to practise what you have learned through an internship at a human rights organization in London, the Professional Seminar Series, and modules about theorizing human rights and social change.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The fourth semester consists of writing your master’s thesis in Human Rights Policy and Practice, based at one of the four partner universities.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-6a50cf842e5f0da51a9c">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="who-should-apply">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-e7763353eb849bb9767d">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Who should apply?
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Apply to the programme if you are looking to gain critical knowledge of human rights and want to pursue international studies. The programme offers a unique interdisciplinary take on human rights, and broaden your skillset with both in-depth academic studies and practical experience.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-8da4703c56ad33e2fa77">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="after-graduation">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-a1c39faa245f21fbb1cf">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               After graduation
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Graduates receive the joint Degree of Master of Arts in Human Rights Policy and Practice, issued by the University of Gothenburg.
               <br/>
               After graduation, you will be prepared to:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 work professionally and effectively with the protection, promotion, and implementation of human rights in a changing global context;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 use analytical skills and expertise in human rights perspectives, contexts, organizations, policy-making, and practice;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 evaluate and apply these skills to different cases and environments;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 and develop human rights-based policies, programmes, and projects with professionalism.
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our alumni work for nongovernmental organizations such as Amnesty International, Doctors Without Borders, and Save the Children, in various UN agencies, and as lawyers, researchers, and teachers.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </article>

      <div class="section-border">
       <div class="section-background">

      <div class="content-wrapper" style="
      
        
      
    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5eea70523055c12a6cc9fc79">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602682979451_15159">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="apply">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-7c335e529d20de45966b">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Application Process
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Application procedures and entry requirement compliance (eligibility) tests are managed by the services of the University of Gothenburg.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The admission procedure is carried out by the Joint Admission Committee of the EMHRPP, composed by the conveners and administrative coordinator at Gothenburg on the basis of commonly pre-determined criteria.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The ranking is divided into three parts:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 academic competence (including English proficiency based on an overall assessment of requested documents);
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 motivation letter;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 work experience and recommendation letters.
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The sum of all three parts can give a maximum of 100 points. Ranking is done taking into account the final score given to each candidate (from the highest to the lowest final score).
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Due consideration shall be given to equal opportunity measures capable of promoting the participation of students from disadvantaged groups.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602682979451_9698">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="entry-requirements">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602682979451_9765">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Entry requirements
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <em>
                To be eligible for the programme you must have the following:
               </em>
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 A first degree equivalent to 180 credits or 180 ECTS from an internationally recognized university or college.
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 A minimum of two year’s practitioner experience in the field of human rights. Practitioner experience may include regular employments, internships, and voluntary work.
                 <a href="/how-to-apply#faq">
                  <em>
                   More information about this under FAQ
                  </em>
                 </a>
                 <em>
                  .
                 </em>
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 A minimum English language qualification of English B/English 6 at upper secondary level or the equivalent level of an internationally recognized test, for example, TOEFL, IELTS, or equivalent alternatives as stated in the call for applications each year by the University of Gothenburg.
                 <a href="https://www.emhrpp.com/how-to-apply#faq" target="_blank">
                  <em>
                   More information about this under FAQ
                  </em>
                 </a>
                 <em>
                 </em>
                 and in the
                 <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EmTOHD73raQSdqf6AAl8KYPeidr26jfn/view?usp=sharing">
                  checklist for application
                 </a>
                 .
                </p>
                <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602682979451_11554">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="selection-criteria">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602682979451_11620">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Selection criteria
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               You also need to provide the documents below as they are used in the ranking process carried out by the Joint Admission Committee of the EMHRPP:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 official transcript of records in English;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 motivation letter in English, well structured, and written in clear and concise language, please use the assigned form available below;
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Curriculum Vitae (CV):
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 and two letters of recommendation
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Read more about this in the
               <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EmTOHD73raQSdqf6AAl8KYPeidr26jfn/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank">
                checklist for application
               </a>
               .
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block button-block sqs-block-button" data-block-type="53" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1615907602462_11386">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-block-button-container sqs-block-button-container--left" data-alignment="left" data-animation-role="button" data-button-size="medium" data-button-type="primary">
              <a class="sqs-block-button-element--medium sqs-button-element--primary sqs-block-button-element" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jzpc1Wv4PN4yFnqtbpak0LoZAR0NA5uY/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank">
               Motivation Letter Template
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602682979451_13209">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="application">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1633623932881_12163">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Application
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Please use the application checklist to make sure you upload all required documents for applying to the programme.
               <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EmTOHD73raQSdqf6AAl8KYPeidr26jfn/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank">
                Checklist for application
               </a>
               . The same applicant is only allowed to apply once a year.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               If you also are applying for the Erasmus Mundus scholarship, find information and form on the
               <a href="https://www.emhrpp.com/costs-and-scholarships">
                <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                 Cost and scholarship page
                </span>
               </a>
               .
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block button-block sqs-block-button" data-block-type="53" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1633623932881_13083">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-block-button-container sqs-block-button-container--left" data-alignment="left" data-animation-role="button" data-button-size="medium" data-button-type="primary">
              <a class="sqs-block-button-element--medium sqs-button-element--primary sqs-block-button-element" href="https://www.universityadmissions.se/intl/apply?admRound=13EMUHT24&applCode=GU-0A002" target="_blank">
               Apply to EMHRPP
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1606733800612_20830">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Key dates
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Admission is closed. Next call for admission will open in October 2025 at the earliest (TBC).
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>

           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1633623932881_24893">

           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1633623932881_13989">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Processing personal data
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               When you apply to the master’s programme, you create an account at the Swedish University Admissions and upload all your documentation there.
               <a href="https://universityadmissions.se/en/about-this-website/processing-of-personal-data/">
                <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                 Read more about how your personal data is processed at the University Admissions website
                </span>
               </a>
               . By applying to an Erasmus mundus programme, the personal data is also processed by the European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA).
               <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/mobility/docs/privacy_statement_emt.pdf">
                <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                 Read more about how your personal data is processed by EACEA
                </span>
               </a>
               <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                .
               </span>
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1606733705860_13579">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="contact-details">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1606733705860_13646">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Contact Details
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Email:
               </strong>
               <a href="mailto:EMHRPPUGOT@gu.se">
                emhrppugot@gu.se
               </a>
              </p>

      <div class="section-border">
       <div class="section-background">
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="content-wrapper" style="
      
        
      
    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5f86fbed62e2e663239fd4e2">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602683574048_13183">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="faq">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602680187430_6360">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Frequently Asked Questions
              </h2>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="row sqs-row">
            <div class="col sqs-col-0 span-0">
            </div>
            <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
             <div class="sqs-block markdown-block sqs-block-markdown" data-block-type="44" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1602663081204_7084">
              <div class="sqs-block-content">
               <h3 id="documentation">
                Documentation
               </h3>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Do you accept the Europass CV?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Yes, any CV format is accepted.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 I have applied in the past, do I need to resubmit the requested documents?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                All documents must be resubmitted except for ToR, diplomas and still valid English test.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Do I need to send my academic documents to University Admissions by AirMail or can I just upload them in the application portal?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Please check the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://www.universityadmissions.se/en/apply-to-masters/provide-application-documents-masters/your-documents-must-be-officially-issued/" target="_blank">
                 required documents for your country
                </a>
                on the University Admissions website.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Can I submit my documents in another language than English?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Work experience certificates, letters of recommendation, motivation letter and other documents to support your eligibility will only be accepted in English, so please make sure to submit an official translation together with the original in case the latter is in another language.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Some academic documents can be submitted in languages other than English, please visit the
                <br/>
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://www.universityadmissions.se/en/apply-to-masters/provide-application-documents-masters/" target="_blank">
                 University Admissions website
                </a>
                to find out what the rules are for your country and level of studies.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Can I send my documents to you directly via email?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                You should upload all documents on the admissions platform directly, unless the country specific requirements state otherwise. You can check these requirements on the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://www.universityadmissions.se/en/apply-to-masters/provide-application-documents-masters/required-documents/" target="_blank">
                 University Admissions website
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 What documents can I submit as proof of residence?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                The proof of residence has to show where you have been living at the time of application. It should be issued within 12 months before the application deadline. Here are some examples of valid documentation you can submit:
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                * A residence certificate issued in accordance with the candidate's municipality’s normal registration rules, in English or Spanish.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                * A certificate from the candidate's place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution. These certificates must be submitted in English, otherwise a certified English translation must be provided with the original.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                * A document confirming the applicant’s place of residence (in English) issued by a notary is also acceptable.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                You can find more valid ways of documenting your residency on the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://www.consilium.europa.eu/prado/en/prado-start-page.html" target="_blank">
                 PRADO website
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Which proof of residence should I submit when I am temporarily living outside of my country?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                You need to submit proof of residence of the country you are living in before travelling to Sweden.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Should my documentation be legalized?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                All documents must be officially issued. You can read more about how to submit your documentation on the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://www.universityadmissions.se/en/apply-to-masters/provide-application-documents-masters/your-documents-must-be-officially-issued/" target="_blank">
                 University Admissions website.
                </a>
               </p>
               <h3 id="eligibility">
                Eligibility
               </h3>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Is there an age limit to apply for the programme/scholarship?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                No, there is no age limit. As long as you fulfill all the criteria you should be eligible.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Am I eligible if I have a degree within x subject?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Degrees within Social Sciences are eligible for the programme, but this does not discard the possibility to be admitted to the programme with a degree within another area, such as engineering, technology, medicine, etc. As long as there is a relevant connection to Human Rights in your background and fulfill the rest of the requirements, you are eligible.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Can I still apply for the programme/scholarship if I do not fulfill all the criteria? I.e. I do not have my English certificate yet or I am missing a few months of work experience.
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                No, you have to fulfill all the criteria by the application’s deadline.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 I have finished my Bachelor´s programme, but my degree will be issued after the deadline, can I still apply?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                If your university can issue a certificate which states that you have finished all your programme courses, and therefore, have the right to a degree which will be issued at a later date, then that should be enough for us to mark you as eligible. This document has to be uploaded on the admissions platform by the application’s deadline at the latest.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Does volunteer work count as work experience?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Yes, as long as it is relevant to the field of Human Rights.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Is my work experience/volunteer work relevant for the programme?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Unfortunately, we are not able to do a preliminary assessment of the relevance your experience has for applying to the programme/scholarship. The reviewing commission will evaluate this upon receiving your application and take the relevant aspects that are in line with the programme into consideration when making their decision.
               </p>
               <h3 id="english-requirements">
                English Requirements
               </h3>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 What are the English requirements I need to fulfill?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                You need to fulfill two different criteria for two different purposes. The criteria you need to fulfill to be admitted to the programme is the one you can read about at the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://universityadmissions.se/en/entry-requirements/english-language-requirements/" target="_blank">
                 University Admissions website
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EmTOHD73raQSdqf6AAl8KYPeidr26jfn/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank">
                 Read more about this in the Checklist for application
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                For the visa requirements, you need to fulfill the requirements stated on the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://www.gov.uk/tier-4-general-visa/knowledge-of-english" target="_blank">
                 gov.uk
                </a>
                website.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 The programme I studied was in English, do I need to submit proof of English proficiency?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Please refer to the instructions available on the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://universityadmissions.se/en/entry-requirements/english-language-requirements/#how-can-i-meet-the-requirement" target="_blank">
                 University Admissions website
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Which English Test is valid to apply for a UK visa?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Students only need an academic IELTS/Other valid English proficiency certificate to apply for this programme. However, since a work placement forms part of one of the Roehampton modules the student will need to apply for a General student visa, as the short-term study visa doesn’t allow for any work.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EmTOHD73raQSdqf6AAl8KYPeidr26jfn/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank">
                 Read more about this in the Checklist for application
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <h3 id="scholarship">
                Scholarship
               </h3>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                <strong>
                 Are the programme application and scholarship application the same procedure?
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                Both processes overlap. If you wish to apply for the scholarship, you need to submit the scholarship application form together with your programme application on the
                <a data-preserve-html-node="true" href="http://www.universityadmissions.se/" target="_blank">
                 University Admissions website
                </a>
                . If you do not upload the scholarship application form, we will process your application as a self-funding candidate.
               </p>
               <p data-preserve-html-node="true" style="font-size:13pt;">
                In case you do not receive the scholarship, you can choose to be processed as a self-funding candidate in the scholarship application.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h1 style="text-align:center;white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Costs and scholarships
               </strong>
              </h1>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

     <section class="page-section layout-engine-section background-width--full-bleed section-height--small horizontal-alignment--center vertical-alignment--middle white" data-animation="none" data-controller="SectionWrapperController" data-current-context='{

"contentWidth": "content-width--custom",

"sectionTheme": "white",

}' data-section-id="5f8f0519cc230807a4b10925" data-section-theme="white" data-test="page-section">
      <div class="section-border">
       <div class="section-background">
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="content-wrapper" style="
      
        
      
    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5f8f0519cc230807a4b10925">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="row sqs-row">
            <div class="col sqs-col-1 span-1">
             <div class="sqs-block spacer-block sqs-block-spacer sized vsize-1" data-block-type="21" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1603209454905_4208">
              <div class="sqs-block-content">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="col sqs-col-10 span-10">
             <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-c1431de9cf87f5a28d79">
              <div class="sqs-block-content">
               <div class="sqs-html-content">
                <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Cost of the programme
                </h2>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The fees are for participation cost alone. Prospective students will also need to factor in for travelling and general living expenses also.
                </p>
                <ul data-rte-list="default">
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Programme country students: 9,000 €
                  </p>
                 </li>
                </ul>
                <ul data-rte-list="default">
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Partner country students: 18,000 €
                  </p>
                 </li>
                </ul>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The tuition fee includes full-time studies, which is normally 60 credits per academic year (30 credits per study semester). For single subject courses, the tuition fee covers the number of credits in the course.
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Fee-paying students at the University of Gothenburg are automatically covered by FAS+ (i.e. no extra fee will be charged for this). FAS+ is an insurance issued under the authority of the Swedish Legal, Financial and Administrative Service Agency (Kammarkollegiet).
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The tuition fee includes access to campus facilities such as libraries, computer labs and other study facilities. The tuition fee also includes student services such as study and career counselling, student health care, disability services and other study administration.
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 <br/>
                </p>
                <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Erasmus Mundus Scholarship
                </h3>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The Erasmus Mundus Programme provides EU-funded scholarships for third-country students and EU/EEA students who have applied to and been accepted by the Human Rights Policy and Practice master´s course. The programme offers around 15 scholarships per year.
                </p>
                <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 How to apply
                </h3>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 If you wish to apply for the scholarship, you need to submit the scholarship application form together with your programme application on the
                 <a href="http://www.universityadmissions.se/">
                  University Admissions website
                 </a>
                 . If you do not upload the scholarship application form, we will process your application as a self-funding candidate.
                </p>
                <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="sqs-block button-block sqs-block-button" data-block-type="53" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1633623392579_3285">
              <div class="sqs-block-content">
               <div class="sqs-block-button-container sqs-block-button-container--left" data-alignment="left" data-animation-role="button" data-button-size="medium" data-button-type="primary">
                <a class="sqs-block-button-element--medium sqs-button-element--primary sqs-block-button-element" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1v-urwudt4V2d7mUVlSSiCw7OUApXmmEd/view?usp=sharing" target="_blank">
                 Apply for scholarship
                </a>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1633623392579_3370">
              <div class="sqs-block-content">
               <div class="sqs-html-content">
                <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Any application emailed directly to teaching staff members will be disregarded.
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 In case you do not receive the scholarship, you can choose to be processed as a self-funding candidate in the scholarship application.
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 <br/>
                </p>
                <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 What does the scholarship cover?
                </h3>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 The student grant covers the participation costs, a monthly allowance for living costs, and a contribution to travel and installation costs. Each grantee will receive EUR 1,000 each month for living costs during the 24-month duration of the programme. The scholarship also includes a contribution to travel and installation and any other type of costs to be paid in two instalments, as well as the Human Rights Policy and Practice participation costs including health insurance coverage for 24 months.
                </p>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 <br/>
                </p>
                <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Eligibility criteria
                </h3>
                <ul data-rte-list="default">
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Scholarship students must have already obtained a first higher education degree or demonstrate a recognized equivalent level of learning according to national rules and legislation in place by the application deadline. That means that scholarship applicants must hold a higher education degree by the programme admissions deadline in mid-January.
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Students who have already obtained an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees (EMJMD) scholarship and former Erasmus Mundus Master/Doctoral Course scholarship holders are not eligible for an additional scholarship under the Erasmus Mundus Masters Courses (EMMC) action. Students benefiting from an EMJMD scholarship cannot benefit from another EU grant while pursuing their EMJMD studies.
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   The list of countries whose
                   <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en">
                    nationals are eligible for a scholarship is presented here
                   </a>
                   . A differentiation between
                   <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en">
                    programme country
                   </a>
                   students and
                   <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en">
                    partner country students
                   </a>
                   is applied. No more than 25% of the total number of scholarships available will be awarded to programme country students.
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Scholarship holders spending part of their EMJMD studies in their country of residence are not entitled to benefit from the monthly living-cost allowance for this period. The monthly living-cost allowance is not given to scholarship holders from partner countries for EMJMD periods exceeding three months (the equivalent of 15 ECTS credits) spent in any partner country.
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Students from partner countries who have carried out their main activity (studies, work, etc.) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in any of the programme countries (EU + Turkey, Macedonia, Norway, Lichtenstein, and Iceland) will be considered programme country applicants according to the 12-months rule.
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   Please note: in any given academic year, student candidates can apply for a maximum of three different joint programmes supported by the Erasmus Mundus scholarships (see the
                   <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/library/emjmd-catalogue_en">
                    Erasmus Mundus catalogue
                   </a>
                   ).
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   A full and timely application is necessary to apply.
                  </p>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                </ul>
                <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Other Scholarships
                </h2>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 There are also a number of other scholarships available from our consortium universities.
                 <br/>
                </p>
                <ul data-rte-list="default">
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   <a href="https://www.deusto.es/en/home/study/scholarships-grants">
                    Deusto Scholarship
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                   <a href="https://www.gu.se/en/study-in-gothenburg/apply/scholarships-for-fee-paying-students">
                    Gothenburg Scholarship
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="col sqs-col-1 span-1">
             <div class="sqs-block spacer-block sqs-block-spacer sized vsize-1" data-block-type="21" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1603209454905_5732">
              <div class="sqs-block-content">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5ee7a2ca860e0d57d0c7bbfc">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-e4d29084c110a607e844">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               University of Deusto
              </h2>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Mission and identity
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Deusto aims to serve society through its contributions with a Christian approach to today’s realities.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               As a university, its guidelines are love of wisdom, desire for knowledge and rigour in scientific research and methodologies. Therefore, its main focus is on achieving excellence in research and education. Another objective is to provide the background for free persons, who are responsible citizens and competent professionals, equipped with the knowledge, values and skills needed to take on the commitment to foster learning and transform society.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                The Deusto University Project
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Deusto has been closely linked to the Society of Jesus’s mission from its beginnings. This makes it part of a worldwide university network and a teaching tradition centred on the individual as the most valuable asset. Our university shares the belief that serving the faith implies fostering justice in today’s world. For this reason, our university has taken on the commitment to make its voice heard by reflecting on cultural issues and encouraging dialogue with social agents wherever man and society are forging their future. Our efforts focus on respect for life, implementing universal human rights, fair distribution of wealth, working for peace and protecting nature.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5ee7a2ca860e0d57d0c7bbfc">
         <div class="row sqs-row">

           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-e4d29084c110a607e844">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               University of Deusto
              </h2>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Mission and identity
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Deusto aims to serve society through its contributions with a Christian approach to today’s realities.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               As a university, its guidelines are love of wisdom, desire for knowledge and rigour in scientific research and methodologies. Therefore, its main focus is on achieving excellence in research and education. Another objective is to provide the background for free persons, who are responsible citizens and competent professionals, equipped with the knowledge, values and skills needed to take on the commitment to foster learning and transform society.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                The Deusto University Project
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Deusto has been closely linked to the Society of Jesus’s mission from its beginnings. This makes it part of a worldwide university network and a teaching tradition centred on the individual as the most valuable asset. Our university shares the belief that serving the faith implies fostering justice in today’s world. For this reason, our university has taken on the commitment to make its voice heard by reflecting on cultural issues and encouraging dialogue with social agents wherever man and society are forging their future. Our efforts focus on respect for life, implementing universal human rights, fair distribution of wealth, working for peace and protecting nature.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5ee7a343bec47e0fd4d03f1d">
         <div class="row sqs-row">

            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               University of Gothenburg
              </h2>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Vision and values
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Gothenburg is a multidisciplinary university that dates back to 1891. We consist of eight faculties and 38 departments. We also have a large number of research and centres of expertise that span across several academic disciplines. These disciplines serve as a meeting point for students, researchers and representatives from the commercial, industrial, and public sectors.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Around 49 000 students and 6 000 staff study and work here, making us one of the largest universities in Northern Europe.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Gothenburg meets societal challenges with a wide range of knowledge. Strong research and appealing study programmes attract scientists and students from around the world. We are environmentally certified and work actively for sustainable development. With new knowledge and new perspectives, our students and researchers contribute to a better future.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The aim of the University of Gothenburg’s quality work is to attain even greater success through its work. This success will be measured in terms of how operations develop and receive recognition, and how this allows the University to maintain its position in comparisons with other educational institutions, both nationally and internationally.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
