    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5eea3dc9be116e76549ce1b3">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-b03cc28e3e2dbb6a98de">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The Arctic University of Norway
              </h2>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Knowlege on top of the world
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               UiT The Arctic University of Norway is a medium-sized research university that contributes to knowledge-based development at the regional, national and international level.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               UiT The Arctic University of Norway is the third largest in Norway and the northernmost university of the world. Its location on the edge of the Arctic implies a mission. The Arctic is of increasing global importance. Climate change, the exploitation of Arctic resources and environmental threats are topics of great public concern, and which the University of Tromsø takes special interest in. At UiT The Arctic University of Norway you can explore global issues from a close-up perspective.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               UiT The Arctic University of Norway is a founding member of the University of the Arctic, an international network of 160 study and research institutions of the circumpolar region. But the University cooperates with all parts of the world. 200 international agreements secure an active academic exchange of students and staff with partner institutions worldwide.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The University of Tromsø has been through three mergers. On the 1st of January 2009 UiT merged with the University College of Tromsø, and on the 1st of August 2013 with the University College of Finnmark. The latest merge was on the 1st of January 2016 with both the University College of Harstad and the University College of Narvik.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

      <div class="section-border">
       <div class="section-background">

      <div class="content-wrapper" style="
      
        
      
    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5ee7a19844891d6c82487574">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-5f2be99c250dad94c503">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               University of Roehampton
              </h2>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                A supportive community where you will belong
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our 9,000 students, who come from all over the world, create a friendly community where you will feel welcome. At Roehampton you are valued as an individual. You will get to know our staff and they will understand how best to support you. Throughout your studies, you will have a Academic Guidance Tutor, and all our academic staff are here to help you succeed.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               We also have a wide range of support services that you can use from your first day onwards, including financial guidance, wellbeing support, online learning and careers support and many opportunities to gain work experience. Our services are tailored to meet the needs of all our students, including those commuting to campus.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               When you graduate, you will join our global alumni network, who will be there for you throughout your career, helping you to build the connections you need to succeed.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Preparing you for the workplace, and for life
               </strong>
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our inspiring lectures work at the leading edge of their subjects and are passionate about what they teach. You will address real-world issues throughout your studies and gain the skills that employers value.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               You will develop the qualities – creativity, adaptability and confidence – that will help prepare you for your career and the workplace of tomorrow.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               We also believe that a university experience does more than prepare you for a successful career. Studying at Roehampton will help you become a confident, rounded individual, with the ability to work with people from all backgrounds and equipped for whatever direction you choose to take in life.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               You will have opportunities throughout your studies to join one of our thriving student societies, play sport and music, volunteer, and make the most of your time with us and access all you need in person, or online.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5f686cee8975d6731c698d3d">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" data-border-radii='{"topLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"topRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomLeft":{"unit":"px","value":0.0},"bottomRight":{"unit":"px","value":0.0}}' id="block-efc8506479bd55c265e3">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Overview
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The EMHRPP (Erasmus Mundus Human Rights Policy and Practice) visiting scholar initiative aims to bring together researchers and professionals from a range of settings and with a common interest in the field of Human Rights Policy and Practice.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               This will be both an opportunity to engage with different ideas and research findings in relation to Human Rights, and an opportunity to network with colleagues from a wide range of countries.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               There will be a particular emphasis put on what expertise you can bring to support the students studying on this programme.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Scholars and guest lecturers can come from both Programme and Partner Countries and their involvement should bring added value to the Masters Program student intake in terms of student-centred teaching/lecturing, research activities, Master thesis support, academic/professional networking, etc.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The participation of high-level scholars/guest lecturers plays an important role in increasing the course attractiveness, and thus the aim is to attract individuals with outstanding academic and/or professional profile to be involved in our Masters Program.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               For more on how scholars and guest lecturers may get involved in Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters Degrees, see
               <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities-under-erasmus" target="_blank">
                https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities-under-erasmus
               </a>
               <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/opportunities/individuals/staff-teaching/erasmus-mundus_en" target="_blank">
               </a>
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Procedures and Key Dates
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Applications should be submitted to
               <a href="mailto:EMHRPPUGOT@gu.se?subject=Procedures%20and%20key%20dates">
                <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                 EMHRPPUGOT@gu.se
                </span>
               </a>
              </p>
              <ol data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 <strong>
                  <em>
                   Deadline first yearly batch of Visiting Scholars:
                  </em>
                 </strong>
                 <em>
                 </em>
                 <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                  <em>
                   10th April
                  </em>
                 </span>
                 <em>
                  . Authors will receive an email notifying them of the results no later than 10th June.
                 </em>
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 <strong>
                  <em>
                   Deadline second yearly batch of Visiting Scholars:
                  </em>
                 </strong>
                 <em>
                 </em>
                 <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                  <em>
                   10th October
                  </em>
                 </span>
                 <em>
                  . Authors will receive an email notifying them of the results no later than 10th December.
                 </em>
                </p>
               </li>
              </ol>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               For questions, please contact
               <a href="mailto:EMHRPPUGOT@gu.se?subject=Queries">
                <span style="text-decoration:underline">
                 EMHRPPUGOT@gu.se
                </span>
               </a>
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Visiting Scholar Role
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Bearing in mind the time of their visit stay, below are a range of activities that are performed by visiting scholars in our EMHRPP program:
               <br/>
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Network with staff and students – creating opportunities for further institutional networking and collaboration.
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Take part in activities for engagement with students and staff.
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Contribute to seminars/talks at the institution(s) for students and staff.
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Conduct a short research project and write a report of the experiences and research during the time.
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Act as a critical friend – interacting with and supporting students.
                </p>
               </li>
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Be invited/encouraged to present a paper on an area related to their area of interest and expertise.
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p class="sqsrte-large" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

    ">
       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-5f8e8c7ae6ed3f10a1aeb80c">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1603355533352_5192">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div id="associated-partners">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-3cad216e8e1094c2f36d">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               <strong>
                Associated partners EMHRPP
               </strong>
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The Associated Partners to the EMHRPP include: City of Gothenburg, Sweden; CSR Sweden, Stockholm; the International Refugee Rights Initiative (IRRI), Kampala, Uganda; Protection International (AISBL), Bruxelles, Belgium; CEAR-Euskadi, Bilbao, Spain; and Region Västra Götaland, Gothenburg, Sweden.
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               In order to incorporate
               <em>
                knowledge from the public sector’s work on human rights
               </em>
               into the Masters Program EMHRPP, two local public sector organisations are involved in the programme as Associate Partner: the
               <em>
                Gothenburg City
               </em>
               and the
               <em>
                Västra Götaland Region
               </em>
               . These Associate Partners offer opportunities for gaining real life experience from human rights implementation and engaging with practitioners in the field. Furthermore, the EMJMD has engaged
               <em>
                CSR Sweden
               </em>
               (CSR standing for Corporate Social Responsibility, CSR Sweden is a national branch of CSR Europe) as an Associate Partner in order to provide insights into the
               <em>
                perspectives of the business community on human rights
               </em>
               . Associate Partners in the
               <em>
                third sector
               </em>
               will also contribute to the programme, namely both
               <em>
                Protection International
               </em>
               (PI) and
               <em>
                CEAR-Euskadi
               </em>
               contribute to the design of modules at the University of Deusto, whereas
               <em>
                International Refugee Rights Initiative
               </em>
               (IRRI) shall collaborate with the Consortium Partner universities in workshops and/or conferences that merge advocacy with academia in the field of human rights.
              </p>
              <p class="" data-rte-preserve-empty="true" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

             </h3>
             <p>
              City of Gothenburg, as a municipality responsible for the major part of welfare services in society, such as schools, housing, elderly care, etc., shall give guest lectures and host study visits for EMHRPP students during the Human Rights as an Interdisciplinary Field module. They shall in particular focus on the practical aspects of implementing human rights as a welfare service provider. Their experience and expertise will also be shared with the Consortium at board meetings and various other occasions as appropriate for module and Programme development.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>

            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <h3>
              Region Västra Götaland
             </h3>
             <p>
              Region Västra Götaland, is a popularly elected regional body responsible for, among other things, healthcare and medical treatment. At the forefront of implementing a human rights-based approach in the public sector and being the only region with a plan of action on human rights, they will share their experiences of developing and implementing this plan of action in their operations with both EMHRPP students in the Human Rights as an Interdisciplinary Field module and in the Consortium Programme Board.
             </p>
            </div>

            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <h3>
              CSR Sweden
             </h3>
             <p>
              A business perspective on the development of policies and work with human rights is the contribution offered by CSR Sweden, in particular during the State, Market and Human Rights module. This will be done through the sharing of best-practice experiences of private actors when addressing challenges of operating in a competitive market and simultaneously implementing human rights in their own operations. Case study material, guest lectures and study visits are some of the resources and activities that CSR Sweden shall bring into the EMHRPP Programme.
             </p>

            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <h3>
              Protection International
             </h3>
             <p>
              Protection International has participated in the design of the new second-term module Human Rights Defenders: Context, Policies and Practice, and will co-teach several sessions in that module regarding security and protection policies and tools. They will also intervene in the module Researching Human Rights, especially in the sessions regarding the management of project cycles. Field visits to PI office in Navarre (170kms from the University of Deusto) can be arranged easily as well as co-supervision of dissertations with fieldwork support.
             </p>

            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <h3>
              CEAR-Euskadi (Basque Refugee Relief Commission)
             </h3>
             <p>
              CEAR-Euskadi is a member of the EU Platform for the Relocation of Human Rights Defenders and coordinates the Basque Government’s Programme for Interim Protection for Defenders of Human Rights. CEAR-Euskadi has participated in the design of the module Human Rights Defenders: Contexts, Policies and Practice and will design professionalising activities for the EMHRPP students in the framework of the Interim Protection Programme.
             </p>
            </div>

           <div class="sqs-block code-block sqs-block-code" data-block-type="23" id="block-yui_3_17_2_1_1622465171089_27513">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <h3>
              International Refugee Rights Initiative (IRRI)
             </h3>
             <p>
              IRRI will offer a graduate placement to at least one EMHRPP student in their Kampala office upon successfully completing the programme. IRRI will retain the right to determine the number of placements and make final admission decisions. This collaboration is particularly relevant to the module Social Movements and NGOs: Understanding Social Change, which will prepare students to apply for positions and work directly with organisations protecting human rights, including advocacy NGOs. The organisation will also collaborate in the design and implementation of events with students including conferences and workshops.
             </p>
            </div>

       <div class="content" style="width: 68%;">
        <div class="sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12" data-type="page-section" id="page-section-60b4a9c31dcb1f52ad13d6f6">
         <div class="row sqs-row">
          <div class="col sqs-col-12 span-12">
           <div class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2" id="block-3e67bba3ef9fcfb95914">
            <div class="sqs-block-content">
             <div class="sqs-html-content">
              <h2 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Accessibility Standards
              </h2>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The consortium universities are responsible for this web site and we want for as many as possible to be able to use it. This page describes how we utilise accessibility to digital public service. It also decribes any known issues, and how you can report flaws to us, so we can solve them. We are constantly working to make sure that the web site fills the requirements set by law.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               How accessible is the web site?
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our ambition is not just to follow the law, but to give all the visitors of the web site an experience where they can perceive, understand, and use all the contents and functionality, in as equal a way as possible, on a web site which uses robust standards for its construction.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               What can you do, if you can't use parts of the web site?
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               If you need information from us in another format, then you can contact us by:
              </p>
              <ul data-rte-list="default">
               <li>
                <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
                 Sending an email to
                 <a href="mailto:emhrppugot@gu.se">
                  emhrppugot@gu.se
                 </a>
                </p>
               </li>
              </ul>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Reporting flaws
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               We are constantly working to improve on the web site's accessibility. If you discover problems that aren't described on this page, of if you believe we do not fill the requirements set by law, then we ask you to tell us, so we can try to solve this issue.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Supervision
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               The Swedish
               <a href="https://www.digg.se/en">
                Agency for Digital Government (DIGG)
               </a>
               is responsible for the supervision of the law on accessibily to digital public service. If you are not pleased with how we handle your thoughts, then you can contact DIGG and let them know.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               How we have tested the web site
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Our accessibility rating is a measure of how well our site performs against standardised web accessibility checks. Our checks are based on
               <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG21/">
                WCAG (The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines)
               </a>
               success criteria categorised by Level A, AA, or AAA conformance levels.
              </p>
              <h3 style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               Technical information about the web site's accessibility
              </h3>
              <p class="" style="white-space:pre-wrap;">
               This web site is created to a high degree of compliance with level AA of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 standard.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
